subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Sweep Tuning of AM Radio Band
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
WOW!! I am amazed that someonme actually tried this! It does work. There was 
a Danish(I think) researcher doing the same thing, but never could make 
contact with them. I have done this myself, and it can work wiht TV too, if 
you can switch channels fast ennough. I think you could use a steeper motor 
controler to randomly turn a stepper moter, to turn the dial. Manually 
spinning the dial has one advantage, the sound is clearer! I have yet to see 
a method of ITC that produces better results that the random tuning methods.

Frank

>
>I have a very sensitive old AM tuner with a flywheel tuning system. I tried 
>several recording sessions manually sweeping the tuner through the AM band 
>late at night. I got pretty good at keeping the dial moving at a constant 
>rate of speed. This is not nearly as good as Frank's 'hands off' random 
>tuning method but it still produced some results. What impressed me most is 
>that some of the voices sound the same, even though I tuned through several 
>channels. This attached capture could be a technical message.
>"Plug a million hertz"   One Million Hertz = 1mhz = 1000khz, which is close 
>the center frequency for the AM broadcast band.
>Dave
